snippet: Russia summoned the American ambassador, Michael A. McFaul, to discuss the arrest of a man it said was a C.I.A. officer, but officials suggested they were ready to move on.
abstract: Russian officials summon American ambassador Michael A McFaul to discuss arrest of Ryan C Fogle, man Russia says is American spy, but officials of both countries say incident will not disrupt ties.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and STEVEN LEE MYERS
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn reported from Moscow, and Steven Lee Myers from Kiruna, Sweden.

lead_paragraph: Russia summoned the American ambassador, Michael A. McFaul, to discuss the arrest of a man it said was a C.I.A. officer, but officials suggested they were ready to move on.

headline.seo: Russia Hints That Spy Case Won’t Disrupt U.S. Ties
headline.main: Despite Focus on Spectacle, Russia Hints Spy Case Won’t Disrupt U.S. Ties
headline.print_headline: Despite Focus on Spectacle, Russia Hints Spy Case Won’t Disrupt U.S. Ties
